data.title: 100 Beautiful Welsh Girl Names: With Meanings
data.meta_description: Keep reading and discover our top 100 Welsh names for girls, and dive deep into their meanings, origins, and popularity today!
data.text:
Aerona

Similar to Aeronwen and Aeronwy, Aerona is not a common Welsh girl name, but it will make your daughter stand out in the crowd. The meaning is “berry” but can also mean “Celtic goddess.”

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Berry

Pronunciation: ay-r-oh-n-uh

Variations: Aero

Afanen

This unusual Welsh female name is pronounced differently between North and South. Raspberries are a popular fruit and are a sweet treat for everyone!

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Raspberry

Pronunciation: a-fa-nen

Popularity: Afanen is slowly gaining popularity in Europe.

Alaw

Alaw started being used due to pop culture references and the famous river Afon Alaw. If you choose this musical name for your daughter, she may learn to dance to the beat of her own drum in life!

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Musical, harmonious

Pronunciation: AH-low

Popularity: Alaw is moderately popular in the Welsh community.

Alys

This Welsh girl’s name is a version of the German name Alice. With celebrities in the arts, Alys may perfectly suit parents who appreciate academia and a strong sense of creativity.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Exalted, noble

Pronunciation: AL-iss

Variations: Ailis

Namesakes: Alys Fowler, a British journalist. Alys Conran, a Welsh novelist. Alys Williams, a Welsh singer, best known for competing in the 2013 reality show, The Voice.

Popularity: Alys is moderately popular and making a comeback.

Angharad

Lady Angharad is a well-known namesake, the mother of the most famous Welsh Latin writer in the 12th-century, Gerallt Gymro. Gerallt credited his success to his mother, just like you could be an inspiration to your daughter by choosing this strong Welsh female name.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Much loved, beloved

Pronunciation: ahng-HAR-ahd

Variations: Angharad, Angharat, Angerona

Namesakes: Angharad Mair, a Welsh television presenter. Angharad Tomos, a famous Welsh campaigner and author.

Argoel

This melodic Welsh girl name translates to “omen” or “a prophetic sign” and resonates with Welsh families. With all the excitement of welcoming your new baby girl, you could consider this name for a strong future.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Omen

Pronunciation: ar-goel

Variations: Argoell, Argoele, Argoelle, Argoela, Argoella

Arianwen

Arianwen was first used in the 5th-century by a Welsh chieftain, Brychan, who encouraged many to keep the Welsh culture and heritage alive. This powerful chieftain’s children were regarded as spiritual or holy beings. Arianwen comes from the Welsh words for “silver” (arian) and “crow” (wen).

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Innocence, purity

Pronunciation: Ah-ree-ann-wen

Variations: Arianwenah, Aryanwin, Arianwin

Namesakes: Arianwen Parkes-Lockwood, an Australian actress.

Arlais

Arlais is a devoted and traditional name for your future Welsh princess. Centuries ago, high priestesses were highly regarded in the community, and this name pulls from their strength and reputation.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: From the temple

Pronunciation: ar-lais

Variations: Arlaes, Arlaise, Arlayse, Arlaese

Popularity: Arlais is similar to Arla, which is extremely popular, consistently ranking in the top 1,000 UK names for girls.

Aures

The gorgeous Welsh name is a special consideration for a new baby. While similar to the word “aura,” your daughter will likely light up every room she enters.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Gold

Pronunciation: au-REs

Variations: Aurelia

Popularity: Aures is slowly gaining more popularity in Europe and the Philippines. In 2012, Aurelia was noted on the top 1,000 girl names in the United States.

Beca

Beca is a solid Welsh name for girls and a common short form of the popular name Rebecca. It also highlights an essential part of history. In the 19th-century, the Merched Beca or Rebecca’s daughters was a collective that fought and protested for a fairer tax system in Wales.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White

Pronunciation: be-ka

Variations: Beca, Becah, Becca, Beccah, Becka

Namesakes: Beca Evans, a beloved Welsh children’s author.

Popularity: Beca ranked #250 for baby girl names in the UK in 2020.

Bethan

Bethan is a Welsh variation of the classic English name Elizabeth. It also translates to “God has sworn” or “God is perfection.”

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: God is my oath

Pronunciation: BETH-an

Variations: Bethanah, Bethne

Namesakes: Bethan Elfin, a Welsh radio and television presenter. Bethan Hanks, a Welsh film actress.

Popularity: Bethan ranked as the 12th most popular among Welsh girl names.

Betrys

Betrys is the Welsh version of the traditional Italian name Beatrice, and both names are popular in Europe. The unique spelling of Betrys makes it a standout choice for any new baby.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Bringer of joy

Pronunciation: BET-riss

Variations: Bettrys

Popularity: Betrys ranked #982 among popular baby girl names.

Braith

The Welsh girl’s name Braith is uncertain but sometimes believed to mean “freckles” or “multi-colored.” An endearing feature for your daughter while also ensuring she views life through a bright, colorful prism.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Black and white

Pronunciation: b-rai- th

Variations: Braithe, Brayth, Braythe

Popularity: In 2017, Braith was in the top 100 girls’ names but has since declined.

Briallen

Watch your daughter bloom as she embodies this beautiful floral name, Briallen. While still low on popularity, the beautiful reference to primroses will match her inner and outer beauty.

Origin: Welsh with a variation in Cornish

Meaning: Primrose

Pronunciation: bree-AH-hlen

Variations: Briallan, Briallon, Briallu

Namesakes: Briallen Clarke, the actor. Briallen Hopper, an author.

Bronwyn

Bronwyn was extremely popular in the 1960s and has constantly evolved with different spellings. This Welsh female name focuses on the beauty a woman leaves through her walk of life.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Blessed

Pronunciation: BRON-win

Variations: Bronwen, Branwen

Namesakes: Browyn Oliver, a metal sculptor. Bronwyn Bishop, an Australian politician.

Popularity: Outside of Wales, Bronwyn is a popular name in Australia, New Zealand, and England.

Caraf

An interesting Welsh name for a girl, Caraf may perfectly capture a daughter’s thoughtful nature. If you wish to foster a caring, loving nature in your sweet girl, Caraf may be a keeper!

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: A feeling of love

Pronunciation: KER-ef

Variations: Cari, Ceri

Popularity: Caraf is mildly popular and experiences generational peaks.

Cari

Cari is a popular unisex name from Welsh origins. It is also a form of the English name Caroline. Let your child shine brightly in the world and guide others on their journeys with this gorgeous name.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: A star in the Orion constellation

Pronunciation: KER-ee

Namesakes: Cari Read, a Canadian gold-medal synchronized swimmer from the 1988 Olympics. Cari Champion, a journalist.

Caron

Caron also translates to “pure” and may encourage your daughter to lead a life encompassed by light. It is also a famous surname in the arts, commonly connected with composers and opera singers.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Loving, kind

Pronunciation: KAH-ron

Variations: Caaron, Carron, Carrun

Namesakes: Caron Wheeler, a British R&B singer.

Catrin

This traditional and historical Welsh girl’s name pays homage to the English name Catherine and the princess Catrin Ferch Owain Glyndwr. Her father launched a rebellion against King Henry IV of England, and her dedicated and loyal citizens followed her into battle.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Poem

Pronunciation: CAT-r-oin

Variations: Caitrin, Catrina, Katri

Namesakes: Catrin Finch, a professional harpist for his majesty, the Prince of Wales. Catrin Aaron, a Welsh television actress.

Ceridwen

Inspired by the Celtic goddess Ceridwen, associated with rebirth, transformation, and inspiration, she is also referred to as the Welsh goddess of poetry. This unique name may encourage your daughter to lead a life of creativity and poetic inspiration.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Beautiful as a poem

Pronunciation: Ke-RID-wen

Variations: Cerridwen

Namesakes: Ceridwen Dovey, a South African social anthropologist, and author.

Cerys

Cerys comes from the Welsh word “caru,” meaning “to love.” It is also a popular name with nature lovers – an iconic landmark in Northern Wales is the Pwll Ceris, a pool of water in the Menai Straits.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Precious, to love

Pronunciation: KER-is

Variations: Carys, Ceris

Crisiant

Crisiant is a stylish name for a boy or girl and may encourage your child to shine bright in your family and the community.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Crystal

Pronunciation: c-risia-nt

Variations: Crysiant, Crysyant, Crisiante, Crisiante, Crysiant, Crysianta, Crysyant

Cymreiges

Here’s a fantastic option to pay tribute to your Welsh heritage. Cymreiges may also allow your daughter to connect with her Welsh roots regardless of how far she travels or who she meets in life.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Welsh woman

Pronunciation: cy-m-rei-ges

Daron

Daron can be traced back through Welsh and Irish history and could be perfect for a family looking to blend and honor both cultures and traditions. Its daring meaning may pave the way for your daughter to look ahead and conquer anything.

Origin: Welsh, Irish

Meaning: Great

Pronunciation: DAR-on

Variations: Daryna, Darynah, Daryn, Darin

Del

Del sounds like a smart option for parents who want to honor unisex or androgenous themes. Del can also be translated to “beautiful” in Celtic.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Small valley

Namesakes: Del Close, an American writer and professor.

Delyth

This Welsh girl’s name is unique and will likely stand out in a crowd – an ideal option for a family that hopes to raise an organized and highly productive little girl.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Attractive in space, neat, tidy

Pronunciation: DEL-ith

Variations: Delithah, Delytha, Delythia, Delythiah, Delythya, Delythyah

Namesakes: Delyth Evans, a Welsh labor politician.

Deryn

Deryn comes from the Welsh word “aderyn” for “bird.” Encourage your daughter to soar and achieve her dreams in the clouds or beyond with this delightful name!

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Little bird

Pronunciation: DER-in

Variations: Derine, Derrine, Derryn

Namesakes: Deryn Rees-Jones, a Welsh poet and novelist.

Dilys

This lovely Welsh female name is shockingly underrepresented, given with a gentle touch to any newborn. Perfect for a family who wishes to raise a young lady with a genuine, honest nature.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Sincere

Pronunciation: DIL-iss

Variations: Dilisa, Dilisah, Dillis, Dillisa, Dily

Namesakes: Dilys Cadwaladr, a Welsh poet.

Disgleirio

Disgleirio is a unique name, hardly heard today, and could be ideal for the star of the show! It may even encourage your little girl to always stand up for what she believes in.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Shine, glitter

Ebril

Ebril is the Welsh word for April. When used as a name, it refers to a daughter going into bloom or reminding the parents of springtime. Ebril has also been used as a popular science fiction name, particularly in the movie The Dark.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Born in April

Pronunciation: ih-BRIHL

Efa

Efa is the Welsh variation of the English female names Eve, Eva, or Ava. This stylish Welsh girl’s name will also hopefully match your daughter’s vibrancy for life.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Life

Pronunciation: ee-fa

Variations: Eve, Eva, or Ava

Namesakes: Efa Gruffudd Jones, the Chief Executive at the University of Wales. Efa Iwara, an actor.

Eilian

If you are looking for a name to honor the past but blend into the present, this Welsh name honors the saint of healing, while also remaining trendy. Saint Elian had many miracles linked to him before his untimely passing.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: A moment in time

Pronunciation: ei-li-an

Variations: Eilin

Namesakes: Saint Elian, best known for founding a church in Northern Wales.

Eira

Eira is especially poetic if you live in a colder climate with heavy winters. Families that choose this name for their daughter may hope to see her celebrate winter holidays and sports.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Snow

Pronunciation: ee-ra

Variations: Aneira, Eyrah

Popularity: Eira ranked #1694 in Norway for popular girls’ names.

Enfys

Enfys can be used as a unisex name and makes families think of brighter days or the calm after the storm. It is a popular choice for the youngest child.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Rainbow

Pronunciation: EN-vis

Namesakes: Enfys Dickinson, a Welsh movie producer. Enfys McMurry, an author. Enfys Beynon Thomas, a Welsh author and illustrator.

Enid

It is a common theme that Welsh names focus on a daughter being pure or giving light to her family. This is because many daughters of Welsh royalty became saints. Enid also holds the Celtic meaning of “spirit.”

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Quiet woman, or soul

Pronunciation: EE-nid

Variations: Enite, Enide

Popularity: Enid has gained popularity over the last decade. In 1920, Enid was one of the top 10 baby girl names in the UK.

Eres

In Welsh traditions, it is important to keep a clear moral compass. If you name your daughter Eres, you may wish for her to follow a path of righteousness and to be sought by her peers for advice.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Admirable woman

Pronunciation: EE-res

Eurolwyn

Eurolwyn belongs to a daughter that likes to explore and discover the world. Having a new daughter will most likely feel like a priceless gift, similar to bringing “blessed gold” into your family.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Blessed gold

Pronunciation: AYR-win

Variation: Eurwyn

Namesake: Eurolwyn William, a Welsh author.

Ffanci

To make the “f” sound in Welsh, you write the letters “ff.” If there is only one “f,” it is pronounced as “v.” Parents could choose this elegant Welsh female name for their beautiful newborn daughter and inspire her to look for decadence and lavish lifestyles.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Fancy

Pronunciation: fan-cI

Fflur

Fflur is an extremely rare and unique Welsh girl’s name, just like your newborn princess. It is a creative choice for families that want their daughter to blossom and be one with nature.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Flower

Pronunciation: F-LEER

Namesakes: Fflur Dafydd, a Welsh novelist and singer-songwriter. Elin Fflur Jones, a Welsh folk singer.

Popularity: As of 2019, less than 3% of the population were named Fflur.

Garan

A stork is one of the common birds in Wales. Giving your daughter this name honors nature and the beautiful countryside of Wales.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Stork

Pronunciation: Gore-ran

Variations: Garren, Garryn, Garynna

Namesakes: Garan Rhys Evans, a Welsh rugby player.

Glain

Let your daughter shine and be her unique self with this delightful Welsh name. Glain may encourage your daughter to demonstrate her inner beauty through her creativity or by giving back to the community.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Jewel

Pronunciation: g-lain

Variations: Glaina, Glayne, Glayna, Glaen

Namesakes: Glain Dafydd, a Welsh harpist. Glain Rhys, a Welsh singer.

Goleuddydd

A child makes every day brighter and will only increase your joy in life. By choosing this traditional Welsh name, she will likely also make your life brighter. Goleuddydd consists of the Welsh words “golau” (light) and “dydd” (day).

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Bright day

Pronunciation: go-leuddy- dd

Gorawen

Children bring a unique light and joy into our lives, and choosing the name Gorawen may undoubtedly bring a deeper sense of joy your way.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Joy

Pronunciation: gor-ah-wen

Variations: Gorawyn, Goraivinne, Gorawynne

Gwen

Gwen is a popular Welsh girl’s name across Europe and the United Kingdom. The legendary Queen Gwendolen continues to inspire acts of bravery and works of art.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White

Variations: Gwenant, Gwenda, Gwenno, Gwendolen, Gwendolyn, Gwener, Gweneth, Gwyn, Gywnne

Namesakes: Queen Gwendolen, wife of King Arthur.

Popularity: Gwen is increasing in popularity, currently ranked #3512.

Gwenhyvar

A unique approach to a legendary name, Gwenhyvar is the Welsh interpretation of King Arthur’s wife Guinevere. The popularity of any Welsh female names similar to Gwendolen or Guinevere will make your daughter hold her head high and confidently.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White ghost, phantom, Holy Spirit

Pronunciation: gwen-hy–var

Variations: Gwenhwfar

Popularity: Gwenhyvar is a common name among Welsh girl names.

Haf

Haf is also used as a middle name and may encourage your daughter to develop a relaxed and worry-free nature. You may even like its Welsh alternative Hafgan, meaning “summer song.”

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Summer

Namesakes: Elin Haf Davies, a motivational speaker. Haf Williams, an author.

Heuldys

Heuldys is not a well-known or popular Welsh female name. It invokes gorgeous imagery, and when anyone thinks of a sunset, they think of love or romance.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Sun setting on the hill

Pronunciation: haul-tes

Heulwen

Heulwen is a Welsh girl’s name with a great blend of rare old traditional Welsh language appropriate in 2022. Perhaps a perfect name for a girl destined to be a ray of sunshine wherever she goes!

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Sun shining

Pronunciation: HAYL-wen

Variations: Heulwin, Heulwinn, Heulwinne

Popularity: Heulwen is growing in popularity.

Iola

While children are priceless, naming your daughter Iola may encourage her to never falter in knowing her worth or value when faced with dilemmas.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Worth or value

Pronunciation: eye-OH-lah

Variations: Iolo, Yola

Popularity: Iola consistently ranks in the top 3,000 girls’ names in the UK.

Irwen

When choosing a name for your daughter, do you imagine her running in the hills or enjoying nature? This Welsh girl’s name may inspire her to appreciate her natural surroundings, regardless of where she lands.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Green or fresh

Pronunciation: ir-wen

Variations: Eyrwen, Irwen

Isolde

Isolde is a popular Welsh and German name, first inspired by Richard Wagner’s famous opera, Tristan and Isoldedue.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: The fair one

Pronunciation: ih-ZOLD-uh

Variations: Esyllt

Leri

Leri specifically references the river Afon Leri located in Ceredigion, Wales. It is also a common short form or second name for parents that want to name their daughter after the Saint, traditionally known as Meleri verch Brychan.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: The Afon Leri or The River Leri

Pronunciation: Lee-Ri

Variations: Meleri, Eleri, Teleri

Namesakes: Saint Meleri, the Queen of Ceredigion who was later canonized.

Lillwen

Lillwen is very unique and instantly paints a picture of lush gardens and a still pond with white lilies. Lillwen is also used for many Welsh local businesses. One floral shop in Carmarthen called Lili Wen Fach is known for its hand-painted floral cakes. This stylish name pays special tribute to a popular flower in North Wales.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White Lilly

Pronunciation: lill-win

Popularity: Lillwen is trending upwards in popularity.

Lilybet

Lilybet combines the Welsh white lily with the traditional British name Elizabeth. It is an excellent compromise for parents trying to blend names while honoring grandmothers and previous generations.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: God’s Promise

Pronunciation: li-ly-bet

Popularity: Elizabeth is ranked #576 in the world.

Linette

Linette is a modernized Welsh name, consisting of the Welsh elements “eluned” and “cilun.” It is a superb option for parents who want to name their daughter the idol or star of the family.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Idol

Pronunciation: lih-NET

Variations: Lynette, Linnet

Lowri

In ancient times, a “crown of laurels” was given to the winner after a battle. It is often associated with victory and could therefore foster a competitive spirit within your daughter. Lowri is also a Welsh female version of the common name Laura.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Crown of laurels

Pronunciation: LOW-ree

Variations: Lauree, Laurri, Lory

Lynn

The Welsh word for “pool of water” is “llyn.” Your daughter could easily flow into your family’s dynamic and be considered as a thing of beauty and grace.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Lake

Pronunciation: LIN

Popularity: Lynn peaked in the 1950s and has become a popular choice for middle names.

Variations: Lynee, Lyn

Mab

This Welsh girl’s name is usually reserved for the youngest child and used as a term of endearment. Mab also means “happy.”

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Baby

Mabli

Mabli is a Welsh interpretation of the name Mabel. It is not well known and translates to “loveable.” For any family welcoming a daughter, Mabli could be an adorable choice as a first or middle name.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Loveable

Pronunciation: MAB-lee

Variations: Moibeal

Maelona

Your family is likely already excited to welcome your daughter, and naming her a “divine princess” may be a special way to show how much you treasure her.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Divine princess

Pronunciation: mae-low-na

Mai

It is a new trend to begin naming Welsh children after the months of the Anglo-calendar year. The month of May reminds everyone of springtime and health. Choosing this name will bring your daughter into the world like a breath of fresh air.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: The month of May

Pronunciation: may

Manon

A popular choice in France, Manon will give your daughter the ability to set her sights on the highest goals. As she grows up, nothing will feel out of reach.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Queen

Pronunciation: mah-NON

Marged

Marged is the Welsh version of Margaret, derived from the Greek word for “pearl.” A pearl is sought worldwide for its unique value and great beauty. Your daughter will also be considered a one-in-a-million acquaintance.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Pearl

Pronunciation: MAHR-ged

Variations: Mererid

Medi

A strong Welsh female name, the month of September is usually associated with the harvest and a bountiful harvest. An inspiring name for a young little lass sure to bring you great happiness.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: September

Pronunciation: med-eye

Megan

Megan is very popular in the UK and Europe. From its Welsh origins, it means “an old soul born in the month of May.” Your daughter may become a thoughtful soul with a name like Megan, reminding everyone she meets of blooming flowers.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Strong

Pronunciation: MEH-gan

Variations: Meghan, Meagan, Meaghan, Maegan, Megyn

Popularity: Megan ranked no.1 among Welsh female names.

Meridith

Ruling over the seas requires someone with a power source that can’t be extinguished. Choosing this Welsh girl’s name for your daughter may help her walk confidently throughout her life.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Protector of the sea

Pronunciation: MEH-ri-dith

Variations: Merry, Meri

Morcan

Besides meaning “bright sea,” Morcan also translates to “dwells near the sea.” Your daughter could be born with saltwater in her veins, naturally swimming and playing in lakes or oceans.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Bright Sea

Pronunciation: mO- rcan

Variations: Morgane

Morgan

Morgan blends the past with the future, beautifully capturing the one natural resource we will continue to protect and cherish- water. Let your daughter be a voice for nature and stand up for what she believes is ethical.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White sea

Pronunciation: MOR-gen

Variations: Morgana, Morganica

Morwen

Being young and energetic, follow this gorgeous Welsh name, Morwen. Let your daughter remain youthful in heart and spirit with a name that sings as playfully as a young maiden.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Maiden, a young girl

Pronunciation: MOR-wen

Myfanwy

This Welsh female name translates to “sweet lady” and “my woman.” A charming way to show your love and dedication for your new girl.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Sweet lady

Pronunciation: mih-VAN-wee

Variations: Myvanwy, Myfi

Nerys

Nerys is a modern interpretation of the traditional name Generys which means “white lady” or “lady of royal standings.” Nerys brings many traditional Welsh qualities to mind and strongly connects your daughter to her heritage.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Lady in nobility

Pronunciation: NER-iss

Variations: Neryss, Nerisse

Nest

Nest is the Welsh variation of the Greek name Agnes, meaning “pure” or “holy.” Choosing this name for your daughter will encourage her to walk a righteous path through life.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Welsh version of Agnes

Variations: Nesta, Amnest

Popularity: Agnes was one of the most popular English names for many years.

Nia

Welsh folklore focuses on creating beautiful and mischievous fairies to carry out tasks for royalty. Nia is a modernized Welsh name, meaning “to have a luster or sheen.” Even if your daughter is mischievous, she will always carry a sparkle.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Fairy, brilliance

Pronunciation: NEE-ah

Variations: Niah, Nya, Nyah

Olwen

This Welsh girl’s name refers to an old friend who walks in purity beside you. Olwen could perfectly capture how your daughter will walk next to her family and make you proud with each step she takes.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White footprint

Pronunciation: OL-wen

Variations: Olwenna, Olwin, Olwyn

Owena

Owena is the feminine version of Owen. It also refers to a young warrior with a pure heart that burns for morality. Owena could be a perfect fit for parents who wish to raise a headstrong lady, not easily intimidated by what life throws at her!

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Born to nobility

Pronunciation: oh-WEN-ah

Variations: Owenah, Owina, Owinah, Owyna, Owynah

Paderau

Paderau is rarely used or chosen anymore. It was more popular among 14th-century families who were devout to their beliefs.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Rosary

Pronunciation: pa-de-rau

Popularity: Paderau has not reached notable popularity outside of Wales.

Philomen

This Welsh girl’s name will connect your daughter to the solar system, finding her smile reflected on moonbeams and stardust.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Lover of the moon

Pronunciation: phi-low-men

Popularity: Philomen is not commonly used but is gaining popularity.

Rhan

A unique choice and a name that will let your daughter choose her own path. A name such as Rhan may help her foster a cautious nature, listening to advice while following her heart.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Fate

Pronunciation: r- han

Variations: Rbann, Rbanna, Rbana

Rhawn

You might choose this Welsh girl’s name to reflect a treasured family characteristic. Rhawn is associated with the famous Knowlton Mansion or the Rhawn Residence in Philadelphia. William Rhawn, the famous affluent banker, lived there and is now protected as a registered historic landmark.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Coarse or long hair

Pronunciation: r- hawn

Namesakes: Rhawn Denniston, a W.H. Norton Professor of Geology at Cornell University.

Popularity: Rhawn is extremely popular in Philadelphia.

Rhedyn

Like the name Rhedyn, a simple fern can hold its own within a majestic forest. Choosing this Welsh girl’s name for your daughter may help cultivate wholesome values and a quiet nature.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Fern

Pronunciation: r-he dyn

Variations: Rheeden, Rheedin, Rheedon, Rheedyn

Popularity: Rhedyn is currently a trending baby name and gaining more popularity in Australia and New Zealand.

Rhiain

Choosing this Welsh female name will reflect your daughter’s purity and gentle nature in your family and community.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Maiden

Pronunciation: RHEE-ine

Variations: Rhian,Rhianen, Rhianwen

Namesakes: Rhian Ramo, a Philipino actress. Rhian Brewster, a Sheffield United Football player.

Rhiamon

Sought for their beauty and magical powers, goddesses play a major role in Welsh folklore and traditions. Choosing a name to remind your daughter of her powerful roots will push her to follow in their mystical footsteps.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Goddess, wisdom

Pronunciation: r-hia mon

Variations: Rhiannon, Rhianon, Riana, Rianne, Riannon

Rowena

A Welsh girl’s name chosen to reflect a family trait. A separate definition of Rowena reflects the popular ash tree found in Wales. Depending on which variation you admire, your daughter will be able to flourish in any environment or space that beckons her.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Little red-haired one

Pronunciation: roe-WEE-nah

Variations: Rhonwen

Saeth

Your future daughter will always follow a path from her heart and walk towards it clearly. Her consciousness will resonate like her name and always fly true like an “arrow.”

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Arrow

Pronunciation: sae-th

Namesakes: Saethryd Brandreth, a journalist, and ghost-writer.

Saffir

Sapphires are internationally associated with royalty and luxury. The Saffir-Simpson Hurricane scale was developed in the 1970s and is still used today to predict the force of natural disasters.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Sapphire

Pronunciation: sa-FEER

Variations: Safira, Safirah, Safire

Sarff

Don’t be intimidated by this Welsh female name’s connection to the serpent. Snakes typically symbolize fertility, rebirth, transformation, and creativity. Let your daughter slide into a path that focuses on her craft and leave an imprint of beauty in the world.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Snake

Pronunciation: Sa-rff

Variations: Sarf, Sarffe, Sarph

Seren

Seren is a beautiful name and will remind your daughter to look up to the universe. It is often associated with bursts of light and guiding others towards their destiny.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Star, serenity

Pronunciation: SEH-ren

Variations: Serena, Serene, Xeren, Xerenah

Popularity: In 2022, Serena ranked #292 among girl names internationally.

Siriol

When you hear this Welsh female name, you can’t help but think of harmony and joy. Siriol could easily sing to your heart just like your daughter’s life will. It’s a melodic Welsh traditional name perfect for any baby girl.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Content

Pronunciation: Sirr-yol

Namesakes: Siriol Burfor, known as the most inspiring women in Wales in 2017. Siriol Jenkins, a Welsh actress. Siriol Joyner, a Welsh choreographer.

Siwan

Siwan can also mean “God is gracious.” The play Siwan, produced in 1956, was dedicated to the illegitimate daughter of King John: Joan the Lady of Wales. The play brought the name back into popularity. When choosing this Welsh girl name for your daughter, she may just illuminate any room she enters.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Bright as the sun

Pronunciation: Shoo-An

Taffy

Taffy instantly brings to mind a sweet friend, good for the soul. This Welsh girl’s name is also popular among families living near the river Taff.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Beloved friend

Pronunciation: taf-fy

Variations: Taafe, Taffea, Taffee

Namesakes: Taffy Nivert, an American singer.

Tanwen

A Welsh name for a girl that inspires confidence. Tanwen reflects a fire burning within and the passion that will keep her motivated.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Shining or holy fire

Pronunciation: tan-gwen

Namesakes: Tanwen Hughes, a Television actress.

Tarian

This Welsh girl’s name is associated with providing refuge and shelter. It is a loving and family-oriented name.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Shield

Pronunciation: tay-ry-An

Variations: Tariane, Tarianne, Taryan, Taryanne

Telyn

A harp is a beautiful instrument that captivates an audience and takes a dedicated and talented individual to master. A daughter with this unique Welsh girl’s name will be in touch with her truth and realize the unique music she brings into the world.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Harp

Pronunciation: te-lyn

Variations: Telynn, Telin, Telynne, Telinn, Telinne

Tirion

A new baby girl will bring a new level of happiness into your home. Your daughter will capture that joy with this Welsh girl’s name and continue to brighten spaces with her smile and gentle personality.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Gentle, happy

Pronunciation: tiri-on

Tiwlip

The National Botanic Garden Of Wales has a beautiful display of Tulips every year. A tulip is associated with spring and is a popular flower sought after for its stunning color variations.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Tulip

Pronunciation: TYOO-lip

Variations: Tulip, Tulipa, Tilippu

Una

A modern and unique Welsh female name bringing images of the ocean and water to mind. A daughter with this name will be a force of nature and continue to surprise you with her energy and focus.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: White wave

Pronunciation: OO-na

Variations: Oona

Vala

A simple name for an impactful person, traced back to German, Persian, and Norse origins. Vala could be a trendy choice for a first-born daughter.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Chosen

Pronunciation: VAH-lah

Popularity: Vala is popular worldwide today.

Win

Welcoming a new child feels like winning the lottery, and why not choose a name to reflect the feeling of success as your bloodline grows.

Origin: Welsh

Meaning: Fair

Pronunciation: win

Variations: Wynne, Wynn, Wyn, Winn
